records.context_note: A violent unrest triggered approximately at [redacted] when Hellenic Police was about to apprehend a Haitian migrant. A group of migrants, with African origin, attempted to release the Haitian national. Episodes escalated, with approximately three hundred (300) participants, mostly African origin. Stones were thrown, and fires were set in bins and containers. Two fires were clearly visible near the EASO and detention areas. Hotspot was ordered to be evacuated. Hellenic Police restored public order. Fires were extinguished. A tent was burnt, a container destroyed. Garbage containers were set on fire. Firefighters vehicle windscreen was smashed. Four office containers (used by NGOs) were totally burnt. Some big tents and smaller tents, garbage bins were burnt. Four containers destroyed, two tents, three containers damaged, eight metal waste bins damaged. Registration area (Frontex containers, RIC, HP and Europol) not affected. EASO coordinator confirmed they are not going to resume work 11/07/2017 or even for a longer period. Registration of new arrivals performed as usual.
records.evidence_quote: A violent unrest triggered approximately at [redacted] when Hellenic Police was about to apprehend a Haitian migrant in order to be handed over the 2nd negative reply, regarding the asylum process.

records.location_details: Minors section of RIC Text removed - Operational Area
records.location_text_raw: Minors section of RIC Text removed - Operational Area
records.context_note: On 10.04.2017 around [redacted] a riot broke out in the minors section of RIC [redacted]. One tent was burnt down, one container was slightly burned. No one was injured. Situation in RIC is calm. 18.04.17 [redacted] informed that the incident will not be investigated. Anti-Riot officers present in the RIC.
records.evidence_quote: 10.04.2017 around [redacted] a riot broke out in the minors section of RIC [redacted].

records.context_note: A Syrian male had a panic attack while being fingerprinted in the [redacted] Hotspot. FX staff report no force was used during the incident. The migrant was given immediate medical attention by FX staff and a doctor at the scene, quickly transported to hospital. FX Finger printing officers have been instructed to proceed with absolute caution in order to prevent a similar situation to occur again, since the migrant should be considered to be vulnerable person. He didn't need extraordinary assistance, nothing else to report.
records.evidence_quote: A Syrian male had a panic attack while being fingerprinted in the [redacted] Hotspot.

records.context_note: On 06/04/2017, at approx. [redacted] Greek time one temporary housing container caught fire. Two migrants, both of them Iraqi males (Age: 22, 23) were apprehended after the incident due to suspicion of arson, and the fire was put out. The container was completely destroyed after the fire. No persons were injured during the incident. No FX staff were present at the hotspot during the incident. HP informs that the above mentioned apprehended persons are detained at Police Premises. The police is investigating the incident. They expect to have both suspects examined by a psychologist today. Head of [redacted] is kindly being requested to inform the [redacted] on the island about such incidents as quickly as possible in the future, as they could have impact on FX activities. There is no more available info. Nothing else to report.
records.evidence_quote: On 06/04/2017, at approx. [redacted] Greek time one temporary housing container caught fire.

records.location_text_raw: Incident between [redacted] CPB and Turkish Coast Guard off [redacted] Island.
records.context_note: Incident between [redacted] CPB and Turkish Coast Guard off [redacted] Island. Embarking 40 migrants to [redacted] CPB [redacted] and safely disembarked them to Port of [redacted]. Immediate report of the incident through regular channels. The day after the event a meeting with Harbour Master took place, [redacted]. FRO office: incident not related to FR - 26/02/2019: Category changed from FR to Standard [redacted] CLOSED.
records.evidence_quote: Incident between [redacted] CPB and Turkish Coast Guard off [redacted] Island.
